name: Resolve
headline: VR simulations for operations, maintenance and construction teams.
description:
At Resolve we’re building the future of simulations using immersive technology like VR and AR. Today, Resolve helps bridge the communication gap between people who operate buildings and those who design and build them. We've built the most robust application for reviewing industrial facilities on wireless VR devices like the Oculus Quest - our customers love it because it just works even with complex 3D building models.

From data centers to cutting-edge biopharma facilities, Resolve provides a collaborative virtual environment for operations & maintenance teams to review and interact with 3D building models at full scale - decreasing late stage changes during the construction process and delivering a safer, more easily operable building.

Our customers' facilities contain a multitude of complex systems which require careful coordination and review to ensure the building is completed on time and within budget. To prevent rework and increased building maintenance costs, Resolve fixes the broken system of screen-sharing 3D models and 2D floorplans with the operations teams that inherit the building and, instead, gives them easy access to their 3D building models before concrete is poured.

# Immersive Building Reviews
By putting your facility in VR and AR, Resolve helps you maintain a high standard of safety, quality, sustainability and efficiency. All while meeting tight construction deadlines.
[Request a demo](https://www.resolvebim.com/<#contact-form>)

## Who is Resolve for?
Smoother turnover and ops
![Owner maintenance & facilities](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e947f9/65bce64615725e2566d2eae1_Owner%20maintenance.webp)
Owner maintenance & facilities
Unlock your digital building model for maintenance & facilities team to increase transparency and solicit better feedback. Simulate emergency procedures, lock out tag out and maintenance walks in VR to avoid retrofits after construction.
Get the job done, no surprises
![Safety & Security](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e947f9/65bcd5e94c7544f5ada67216_DeWatermark%204.webp)
Safety & security
Host safety and security reviews with multiple stakeholders from facilities, engineering and construction to simulate machine safety reviews and mitigate risk.
No more ambiguous feedback
![GCs & Engineers](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e947f9/65bcd5e91e58e6ad9456543b_GCs%20%26%20Engineers.webp)
GCs & engineers
Avoid late stage changes and complaints by ensuring the design model meets owner requirements.
## VR and AR with results, without the hassle
With Resolve’s [Wellington Engine](https://www.resolvebim.com/<https:/www.resolvebim.com/wellington-engine>), you can open huge BIM files on wireless XR devices without having to downsize them. Resolve can open 1 billion polygon models without a PC.
See up to 11x more feedback from stakeholders who usually take a back seat in the review process. From trip to shock hazards, Resolve will help you identify issues before it’s too late.
You can virtually perform safety inspections, emergency procedures or lock out/tag out to ensure alignment with building operations needs.
Stay on schedule
Get feedback before construction starts to avoid late stage changes, rework, and delays.
Improve ops & safety
Review equipment maintainability and access to ensure smooth operations across the building lifecycle.
Build sustainably
Reduce travel and hours of time consuming meetings. Also cut down on material waste from rework.
Increase the ROI of BIM
Get more people engaged with the detailed models already being created for your facility.
## Enterprise ready, SOC 2 compliant, and capable of opening billions of polygons
## VR integrations and workflows for
[![ACC](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e947f9/65bc2dd326012e85a1e94818_ACC.webp)](https://www.resolvebim.com/</integrations-workflows>)[![BIM+360](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e947f9/65bc2dd326012e85a1e94819_BIM%2B360.webp)](https://www.resolvebim.com/</integrations-workflows>)[![procore](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e947f9/65bc2dd326012e85a1e9481b_procore.webp)](https://www.resolvebim.com/<https:/www.resolvebim.com/workflows/procore-vr>)
[![Navisworks VR](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e94802/65bcaede3ba4ec33b06eac05_Navisworks%20VR.webp)](https://www.resolvebim.com/</workflows/navisworks-vr>)
[![Newforma Konekt VR](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e94802/65bcaf0970d4caa03aba540a_Konekt.webp)](https://www.resolvebim.com/</workflows/newforma-vr>)
[![Revizto VR](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e94802/65bcaf2ca047a0e4626d807c_revizto-logo.webp)](https://www.resolvebim.com/</workflows/revizto-vr>)
Procore & Autodesk Construction Cloud / BIM 360
Resolve’s native integrations with Autodesk Construction Cloud and Procore automatically keep models up to date in VR without having to export or upload with each design change. Resolve detects and processes new model versions behind the scenes so VR reviews are always up to date.
Gone are the days where you have to prep, export and upload models to “do VR.” Now with our Procore and ACC integrations, models are automatically processed and remain up to date in VR whenever you upload new versions to your Procore or ACC.
![Procore & Autodesk Construction Cloud](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65bc2dd326012e85a1e947f9/65bc2dd326012e85a1e9481c_Screenshot.webp)
Speech-to-text annotations
Inspect BIM properties
Easy multi-user collaboration
Annotate by measuring and sketching
Issue tracking integrations
Follow along with the desktop companion app

Resolve's support for complex models on standalone VR devices enables teams to interact with building information models (BIM) more independently even while working remotely.
[Learn more](https://www.resolvebim.com/<https:/www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/resolve-partners-with-anglian-water-one-alliance-to-improve-operations-access-to-3d-assets-with-virtual-reality-301394766.html>)
## How Fortis Construction saved $3 million in 3 months with VR BIM reviews
Fortis Construction used virtual reality to review BIM more efficiently and prevent $3 million in rework on a large data center project in Singapore. Learn how VR can help your construction process today.
Angel Say - Jan 9, 2024
8 min read
[Read](https://www.resolvebim.com/<https:/blog.resolvebim.com/how-fortis-construction-saved-3-million-in-3-months-with-vr-bim-reviews/>)
## Testimonials
Gurmanjit Thind
Integrated Construction Technology Coordinator 
"Before Resolve I tried and tested multiple different VR programs only to come to conclusion that large scale VR models won't be possible for at least 2-3 years; I was very wrong."
Matthew Methley
Digital Delivery Advisor 
"In 2023 we switched our VR software to Resolve, as we incubated the technology for our digital design review process. Previously we’d split our models into smaller files to enable the reviews in VR. Now, using Resolve, we’re able to load the entire federated models seamlessly, directly from ACC. ”
Jake Lovelace
Senior Innovation & Ops Tech Specialist
"Resolve is the only XR solution we have found that can seamlessly render large production BIM files at a quality that our clients and project teams expect. Their game-changing technology has enabled immersive design review sessions that facilitate better decision making and client engagement."
Luke Barendse
MEP Coordination Lead
"Resolve is hands down better than the previous software we’ve used at MMFS. Quick setup, quick load, easy to update projects. We’ve had multiple users from different states all working seamlessly in the same model that would not be possible in other software. Safe to say, we like it a lot."
## FAQ
How is Resolve different from other VR and AR apps for construction and design?
Our custom technology powering Resolve can open huge BIM files in a wireless Oculus Quest. No sectioning or model prep necessary. Other Quest apps will run at low frame-rates or even crash when handling similar model sizes. In order to connect operations teams to design teams we believe it’s necessary to have both wireless headsets and large models. Hence, Resolve. 
What size model can Resolve handle? 
The largest customer model that we ever received was a 1.16 billion (with a b) polygon model. It ran at 72 frames per second on a standalone, wireless Quest 2. Our customers commonly open 5GB Navisworks files and 10gb Revit files. 
What file types does Resolve accept?
Any BIM file hosted on Autodesk Construction Cloud, BIM 360 Docs, or Procore. We support 70+ different file formats. We’ve tested Navisworks (NWD), Revit (RVT), Smartplant (VUE) files, IFC, and more.
Which VR or AR headsets does Resolve support?
Resolve supports the Oculus Quest 2, Quest 3 and Quest Pro. There is a PC companion app to join and follow meetings from your computer if you cannot use a headset. And there is a recently launched app for Apple Vision Pro too!
Is this better than using a Link cable?
Yes. Resolve doesn’t require a connection to an external gaming computer. This makes VR easily accessible from anywhere and saves teams the stress of complex set ups - it just works.

generated_description:
### Company Overview: Resolve

**Company Name:** Resolve  
**Founded:** 2014  
**Location:** New York City  
**Team Size:** 9 employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** W15  
**Group Partner:** Dalton Caldwell  

**Website:** [resolvebim.com](https://www.resolvebim.com)  

---

### Mission

At Resolve, we’re pioneering the future of operational simulations using immersive virtual (VR) and augmented reality (AR) technologies. Our mission is to facilitate seamless communication between those who operate buildings and the teams that design and construct them.

---

### What We Do

Resolve addresses a critical gap in the construction and facility management industries by providing advanced VR simulations. Our flagship application enables operations and maintenance teams to interact with detailed 3D building models, even in complex environments like data centers and biopharma facilities. This immersive technology effectively reduces late-stage changes during construction and enhances overall safety and operability of buildings.

**Key Features:**

- **Easy Access to 3D Models:** Resolve allows teams to review and interact with their facilities in real-time using wireless VR devices, such as the Oculus Quest. Unlike other solutions, our technology can handle massive models—up to over a billion polygons—without performance issues.
- **Enhanced Collaboration:** The immersive platform gathers feedback from stakeholders who typically might not engage deeply in the review process, enabling early identification of issues and streamlining project workflows.
- **Integrated Workflows:** Resolve works seamlessly with leading BIM tools and integrates with platforms like Autodesk Construction Cloud and Procore, ensuring that the latest design changes are readily available in VR.
- **Focus on Safety and Sustainability:** By simulating emergency procedures, maintenance routines, and equipment accessibility in a virtual space, buildings can be operated more efficiently and sustainably, reducing waste and improving safety measures.

---

### Customer Impact

Our customers have leveraged Resolve to achieve significant outcomes, including Fortis Construction saving $3 million in rework costs on a major project by utilizing VR for BIM reviews. Other testimonials highlight our solution’s ability to facilitate better decision-making and improve overall project transparency.

---

### Industry Tags

- **Virtual Reality**
- **Construction**
- **Design Tools**
- **Metaverse**
- **New York**

---

### Conclusion

In a world increasingly reliant on effective digital tools, Resolve is transforming how the construction and operational management sectors perceive and interact with building models. By merging cutting-edge technology with practical applications, we are laying the groundwork for a more connected, efficient, and safe future in building operations.
